Description: Multiple presumptive drug tests billed on same date of service. Only one presumptive drug test is reimbursable per day regardless of methodology or provider.
Modifiers: None override - modifier will NOT allow separate reimbursement
Detection_Logic: Count all presumptive codes for same patient same DOS across ALL providers. If count > 1 deny subsequent claims.

Description: Multiple definitive drug tests billed on same date of service. Only one definitive drug test is reimbursable per day regardless of drug classes or provider.
Detection_Logic: Count all definitive codes for same patient same DOS across ALL claims. If count > 1 deny subsequent claims.
Example_Claim: CLM-005: G0481 PAID, CLM-006: G0482 DENIED (same DOS)

Description: Definitive drug testing CPT codes 80320-80377 are non-reimbursable. Use HCPCS G0480-G0483 or G0659 instead.
Detection_Logic: If claim contains any CPT code in range 80320-80377 auto-deny. These are never reimbursable per CMS guidance.

Description: Specimen Validity Testing is included in drug testing codes. Not separately reimbursable when performed on same date as drug test.
Modifiers: Modifier 59/XE MAY allow if documentation proves distinctly separate service (e.g. UTI)
Other_Codes_ICD: ICD-10 should support separate medical necessity (e.g. N39.0 for UTI vs F11.x for opioid disorder)
Denial_Conditions: SAME_DAY, SAME_PATIENT, SVT_CODE + DRUG_TEST_CODE, NO_MODIFIER or MODIFIER_WITHOUT_DOCUMENTATION
Detection_Logic: If SVT code AND drug test code on same DOS deny SVT UNLESS modifier 59/XE present AND documentation supports separate service.
Example_Claim: CLM-011: 80306 PAID + 81001 DENIED; CLM-012: 80307 PAID + 81001+59 PAID (with docs)

Description: Drug testing services that are court-ordered and/or funded by government agency are not reimbursable.
Other_Codes_ICD: Claim indicators for court-ordered; Payer source = government agency
Denial_Conditions: COURT_ORDERED = TRUE, OR PAYER_SOURCE = GOVERNMENT_AGENCY, OR ORDERING_ENTITY = COURT/PROBATION/PAROLE
Detection_Logic: If claim indicates court-ordered or payer source is government agency deny claim. Check remarks and ordering provider fields.
Example_Claim: CLM-013: 80305 Court-ordered DENIED; CLM-014: G0481 Probation requirement DENIED

Description: Drug testing codes describe a per-day service. Units > 1 should be reduced to 1.
Detection_Logic: If units billed > 1 for any drug testing code reduce units to 1 and pay for 1 unit only.
Example_Claim: CLM-015: 80307 x5 units -> PARTIAL paid 1 unit; CLM-016: G0482 x3 -> PARTIAL paid 1 unit

Description: Provider bills multiple presumptive tests using different methodology codes claiming they used different testing methods.
Detection_Logic: Provider runs single specimen through multiple screening methodologies and bills each separately claiming each is different service.
Example_Claim: CLM-F1: 80305+80306+80307 all same DOS for same specimen

Description: Provider bills both HCPCS G-codes and PLA codes for definitive testing on same day claiming they are different tests.
Detection_Logic: Bill standard definitive test AND proprietary lab test for same specimen claiming proprietary test provides additional information.

Description: Same entity uses multiple NPIs or refers specimen to different lab to bill tests multiple times.
CPT_HCPCS_Codes: Any drug testing codes under different NPIs/TINs
Modifiers: None needed - exploit relies on different provider identifiers
Detection_Logic: Lab A bills presumptive. Lab A sends specimen to affiliated Lab B which bills another test. Both labs under common ownership.
Example_Claim: CLM-F3A: NPI-AAA 80307; CLM-F3B: NPI-BBB G0481 (same entity)

Description: Provider bills specimen validity tests as separate services alongside drug tests.
Other_Codes_ICD: False ICD-10 codes (e.g. N39.0 UTI when no UTI symptoms)
Detection_Logic: Bill SVT with modifier 59 and unrelated diagnosis to bypass bundling edit even though tests are solely for validating specimen.

Description: Provider bills CPT codes 80320-80377 knowing they are non-reimbursable hoping for payment error or appeals.
Detection_Logic: Bill individual drug codes which provide higher itemized reimbursement vs single G-code relying on payer system gaps.

Description: Provider bills higher-tier definitive test code when fewer drug classes were actually tested.
Detection_Logic: Bill G0483 (22+ drug classes highest reimbursement) when actual panel only tested 8-10 classes. Documentation not verified.
Example_Claim: CLM-F6: G0483 billed but only 9 classes tested (should be G0481)

Description: Provider bills same test on consecutive days by manipulating date of service to bypass same-day edit.
Detection_Logic: Specimen collected once but billed on two consecutive dates to bypass same-day duplicate edit.
Example_Claim: CLM-F7A: 80307 DOS 02/07; CLM-F7B: G0481 DOS 02/08 (same specimen)

Description: Provider bills both presumptive AND definitive tests routinely without medical necessity.
Modifiers: None needed - both allowed same day (one each)
Detection_Logic: Bill presumptive then automatically bill definitive for every patient regardless of clinical need when policy states presumptive not required.
Example_Claim: Every patient every visit: 80307 + G0482 without clinical justification
